events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on the highway, requesting formal claim initiation.
Based on initial report and keywords, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident for further processing.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident case to ensure quick support.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of their auto accident claim and was informed about the next steps.
Request sent to the customer for submitting police report, vehicle damage photos, and driverâ€™s license copy.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report and vehicle repair estimates on the portal.
Claims investigator started a detailed review of the submitted evidence and the accident circumstances.
The investigation concluded confirming the coverage validity and liability related to the auto accident.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repairs and towing expenses was proposed to the customer following investigation.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the quick turnaround and fairness of the proposed settlement.
Management approved the settlement and authorized the payment release for the auto accident claim.
The approved payment was issued to the customer's bank account to cover vehicle repair and other expenses.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and customer satisfaction.
All documents and communications related to the auto accident claim were archived for record keeping purposes.
